title.content-text: 5.3.3 - A Gateway - The Way Out of Our Network

brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts how each host on a particular LAN has the same default gateway address, which is the address of the gateway interface connected to this network. The gateway for a Windows PC is configured using TCP/IP Properties. A screenshot of the Windows TCP/IP Properties is shown for PC2.

Network Topology:
Hosts PC1, PC2, and PC3 are connected to switch S1 in LAN1 (network 192.168.1.0/24). Switch S1 is connected to gateway router R1.

PC1 IP Address: 192.168.1.1/24
PC1 Gateway Address: 192.168.1.254/24
PC2 IP Address: 192.168.1.2/24
Gateway Address: 192.168.1.254/24
PC3 IP Address: 192.168.1.3/24
PC3 Gateway Address: 192.168.1.254/24
Router R1 gateway LAN interface IP address: 192.168.1.254/24

PC2 Windows TCP/IP Properties Screenshot
IP Address: 192.168.1.2/24
Subnet mask: 255.255.255.0
Gateway Address: 192.168.1.254/24
